messages.subject: Re: [nihonto] Kodogu:  Kaga Goto and Kaga Kinko
messages.msgSnippet: Curran, You couldn t have picked a better school to study.  I too have had taikan and find it to be just pure drooling material.  Even if you separate the
messages.messageBody:
Curran,

You couldn't have picked a better school to study.  I too have had taikan and find it to be just pure drooling material.  Even if you separate the fact that the schooled recognized the mantis in a lot of their works (just showing their high class taste), their mastery over kinko work is clearly demonstrated over and over.  The Maeda family did a good job in sponsoring the local talent to say the least!  Would love to see/hear and feel (you really can feel the quality in their work), but I would settle for any info you can share.  Good luck with it.
Ken




>________________________________
>From: Curran Campbell <neobliviscar@...>
>To: token_kenkyu_kai@...
>Cc: nihonto@yahoogroups.com; nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
>Sent: Sunday, July 3, 2011 10:48 PM
>Subject: [nihonto] Kodogu: Kaga Goto and Kaga Kinko
>
>
> 
>Lists,
>
>I have had the Kaga Kinko Taikan for many years and recently purchased a quiet Maeda mon mitokoromono of Kaga work. I just passed on a nice Kaga Goto kozuka that I did like but felt was priced too high. It seems July would be a good month to devote to the study of Kaga Kinko.
>
>If anyone has any papered Kaga Kinko or Kaga Goto items, I'd love to see any pictures and share any insights into these works.
>
>I wish a good 4th of July to the USA members.
>
>Curran
>Sarasota / NYC
>
>[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
>
>
>
>

messages.subject: Kodogu:  Kaga Goto and Kaga Kinko
messages.msgSnippet: Lists, I have had the Kaga Kinko Taikan for many years and recently purchased a quiet Maeda mon mitokoromono of Kaga work. I just passed on a nice Kaga Goto
messages.messageBody:
Lists,

I have had the Kaga Kinko Taikan for many years and recently purchased a quiet Maeda mon mitokoromono of Kaga work. I just passed on a nice Kaga Goto kozuka that I did like but felt was priced too high. It seems July would be a good month to devote to the study of Kaga Kinko.

If anyone has any papered Kaga Kinko or Kaga Goto items, I'd love to see any pictures and share any insights into these works.

I wish a good 4th of July to the USA members.

Curran
Sarasota / NYC



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
